snippet.title: The IPCC's Latest Report Deliberately Excludes And Misrepresents Important Climate Science
snippet.description: This week, the United Nations’ Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) is releasing its latest report, the “Working Group II Contribution to the Fifth Assessment Report.” Like its past reports, this one predicts apocalyptic consequences if mankind fails to give the UN the power to tax and regulate fossil fuels and subsidize and mandate [...] read »

snippet.title: NetApp​Voice: As Cloud Market Heats Up, Amazon Web Services Now Better And Cheaper
snippet.description: Amazon announces interesting new features for Amazon Web Services (AWS) and certification by the Department Of Defense (DoD). It also slashes prices. On the one hand, the AWS cloud services are even more competitive than they were last week. On The Other Hand, the entire cloud-services market is getting more competitive, so [...] read »

snippet.title: 8 Ways To Build And Use The New Breed Of Data-Driven Applications
snippet.description: By Brian Ascher, partner at Venrock Software-as-a-Service and cloud computing has been transformational for the software industry, but compared to what is coming next, you ain’t seen nothing yet. First, to appreciate where we are heading a quick review of where we’ve been is in order. Back in the olden days of business [...] read »

snippet.title: How Wayfair Sells Nearly $1 Billion Worth Of Sofas, Patio Chairs And Cat Playgrounds
snippet.description: Wayfair is the Web's Sears, Roebuck. But its business is as much data mining as retailing. read »

snippet.title: Tweeting Scientists Find Penile Fracture And 'Sperm Bags Of Squid' Just As Funny As Everyone Else Does
snippet.description: Funny or startling science news generally tops the Twitter charts, even when academics are doing the tweeting, according to a new study. Of the most tweeted peer-reviewed articles published between 2010 and 2012, based on over a million documents from the PubMed and Web of Science databases, many had something of a humorous slant to them. The top [...] read »

snippet.title: 7 Science-Based Parenting Practices
snippet.description: I'm pleased to announce that my science-writing work has been selected for inclusion in Open Lab 2013, an anthology of the best science writing on the Web. The piece that landed me among a field that includes Aatish Bhatia, Deborah Blum, Matthew Francis, Maggie Koerth-Baker, Seth Mnookin, Jennifer Ouellette, and other wonderful [...] read »

snippet.title: Profit Expected to Dip for Adobe Systems
snippet.description: Despite an expected dip in profit, analysts are generally optimistic about Adobe Systems as it prepares to reports its first-quarter earnings on Tuesday, March 18, 2014. The consensus earnings per share estimate is 12 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of 55 cents per share for the fiscal year. After [...] read »

snippet.title: NetApp​Voice: Here Comes European Net-Neutrality, Despite Criticism Of 'Connected Continent' Rules
snippet.description: The European Parliament has kick-started the high-speed train to network-neutrality. And once they've got next month's elections over with, they're expected to get on with the messy business of lawmaking. On the one hand, fans of the so-called "open Internet" are rejoicing. On The Other Hand, beware of unintended consequences... [...] read »
